thread.title: MSU will raise Final Four banner at Midnight Madness
thread.title_full: MSU will raise Final Four banner at Midnight Madness

title: MSU will raise Final Four banner at Midnight Madness
text:
MSU will raise Final Four banner at Midnight Madness Joe Rexrode, Detroit Free Press 11:27 p.m. EDT October 22, 2015 Tom Izzo, dressed as a member of the band KISS for Midnight Madness in 2014 (Photo: File) 
As of Tuesday, Tom Izzo still didn’t know what he would be wearing tonight in his annual pre-Halloween costume party – his introduction at Midnight Madness, which in the past has seen him riding a motorcycle, dressed as a hippie and rocking on stage as a member of KISS. 
“I try to find out later and later and later so I can get out of something,” joked the MSU men’s basketball coach, who will sign autographs along with MSU women’s coach Suzy Merchant and players from their teams starting at 8:30 tonight at Breslin Center. 
The event, free to the public as always, gets started at 9:30 and the women’s team will be introduced at 9:50. The men’s team will be introduced at 10:15 and the event will include both teams scrimmaging and the raising of the Final Four banner that Izzo’s team earned last season. 
As usual, the most anticipated sight will be Izzo as … something. 
“I don’t know why I keep doing it – part (MSU athletic director Mark) Hollis, part our incredible marketing department, part the fun of being able to make a fool of yourself and laugh at yourself … It really is a fun night,” Izzo said. “You get to enjoy it with young kids that don’t normally get to see the game. That’s the cool part of Midnight Madness for me, a lot of people that don’t get to enjoy the games during the year get to come and with their parents.” Where was Izzo? In the Big House tunnel, of course 
Fans can enter at gates A, B, C and D. Because there’s an MSU hockey game Friday night at Munn Arena, parking is $5 before 7:15 p.m. and free after that where available. There will be a shuttle from the Communication Arts and Sciences parking ramp at the corner of Red Cedar and Trowbridge roads starting at 7:30. 
The first 4,500 fans will receive a free Final Four 2015 seat cushion. Izzo will be signing autographs across from section 108 and Merchant will be across from section 129, with their players spread out around the concourse. Read or Share this story: http://on.lsj.com/1LQumh8 TOP VIDEOS
